statement.tex:
\text{If x and y are connected parametricaly by the}\\ \text{following equations, without eliminating the}\\ \text{parameter ,Find }\frac{dy}{dx}\\
x = a\Bigg(\cos t + \log \tan \dfrac{t}{2}\Bigg), \quad y = a\sin t\\

step.reason: \text{For calculating }\frac{dp}{dq}\text{we just divide}\\ \frac{dp}{dt}\text{ by }\frac{dq}{dt}\text{ as p and q are function of t.}\\

step.tex:
\begin{align} \frac{d(x)}{dt} &= \frac{d\Bigg(a\Bigg(\cos t + \log \tan \dfrac{t}{2}\Bigg)\Bigg)}{dt}\\ &=\frac{a\Bigg(d(\cos t)}{dt} + \frac{d\Bigg(\log \tan \dfrac{t}{2}\Bigg)\Bigg)}{dt}\\ &=a\Bigg(- \sin t + \frac{1}{2}\frac{sec^2 \dfrac{t}{2}}{\tan \dfrac{t}{2}}\Bigg)\\ &=a\Bigg(-\sin t +\frac{1}{\sin t} \Bigg)\\ &=a\Bigg({-\sin^2 t +1}{\sin t} \Bigg)\\ &=a\Bigg(\frac{\cos ^2 t}{\sin t} \Bigg)\\ &=a . \cot t. \cos t
\end{align}
step.reason: \text{Other than Chain Rule we have used the}\\ \text{fact that }\frac{d(\sin \theta)}{d\theta} = \cos \theta \, ,\frac{d(log \theta)}{d\theta} = \frac{1}{\theta}\text{ and }\\ \frac{d(\tan \theta)}{d\theta} = \sec^2 \theta
\text{Other than Chain Rule we have used the}\\ \text{fact that }\frac{d(\sin \theta)}{d\theta} = \cos \theta

step.tex: \frac{dy}{dx} =\frac{ \dfrac{d(y)}{dt}}{\dfrac{d(x)}{dt}}\\ \\ \text{Substituting, }\dfrac{d(x)}{dt}\text{ and }\dfrac{d(y)}{dt}\text{ in the above}\\ \text{equation.}\\ \begin{align} \frac{dy}{dx} &=\frac{a . \cos t}{a . \cot t. \cos t }\\ &=\frac{1}{\cot t}\\ &=\tan t \end{align}
